recipes.title: Mish-Mash
recipes.method: 1.Finely dice bell peppers. Coarsely chop tomatoes. 2.In a large heavy skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. First, add the onions and garlic, and sauté for about 2 minutes, until the onions are soft, but not completely cooked. 3.Add the bell peppers and mix well. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes. 4. Add the tomatoes, stir, cover and cook for another 5 to 7 minutes. 5.Add the sirene and mix. Pour the eggs. Stir occasionally until the mixture is less liquid.6.Finally add the parsley and cook for a minute before removing from heat. 7.Serve hot

recipes.title: Avocado and Smoked Salmon
recipes.method: 1. No preparation required!just grab and enjoy 2.Season with fresh lemon juice and black pepper to taste

recipes.title: Chia & Oat Pudding
recipes.method:
Ideally make this the night before, put the chia seeds, rolled oats, almond milk, maple
syrup and vanilla extract into a bowl and stir. Next, cover with cling film and put in the
fridge overnight. When you are ready to eat, finish with your choice of toppings.

recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs, Avocado and Rye Toast • 2
recipes.method:
1. Mash half an avocado using the back of a fork.
2. Crack the eggs into a bowl, add the egg white and whisk thoroughly. Place the coconut
oil into a pan and heat it up. Cook the egg mixture, stirring continuously until they are
at your desired consistency.
3. Toast the rye bread and once done spread the avocado on top. Place the eggs on the
side.
4. Serve.
